com.ptc.windchill.esi.lite.tgt.webject

Class WriteToFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ptc.windchill.esi.lite.tgt.webject.WriteToFile
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    WriteToFTP

    public class WriteToFile
extends java.lang.Object
    Implementation for Write-To-File custom webject for ERPConnector

    Supported API: true

    • Method Detail

      • writeToFile

        public static Task writeToFile(Task task)
                        throws IEException
        Writes the output (representing the ESI response) at the specified location. Expects the FILE_NAME and PATH parameters for its functioning. When writing the output in the ESI XML format, either the CONTENT parameter or the GROUP_IN parameter holding the I*E collection and distribution target (but not both) may be passed in (the XSL_URL, XSL_DBUSER, XSL_PASSWD and XSL_PARAM parameters may optionally be passed in as well); when writing in any other format (say, PLM), the GROUP_IN parameter holding the I*E collection, distribution target and primary business object (but not the CONTENT parameter) needs to be passed in.

        Supported API: true
        Parameters:
        task - The Info*Engine task
        Returns:
        The resulting Info*Engine task
        Throws:
        IEException

      • cacheResponse

        public static void cacheResponse(WTContained object,
                                 java.lang.String fileName,
                                 java.io.File outputFile)
                          throws WTException,
                                 java.io.IOException
        Creates a cache of the contents of the input file, based on the values of following ESI preferences.
        1. Enable Response Cache
        2. ESI Response Cache Location


        Supported API: true
        Parameters:
        object - - WTContained object to use when fetching the values of preferences; this is typically the primary business object that was released.
        fileName - - Name of the file whose contents are to be cached;
        outputFile - - File instance representing the file whose contents are to be cached.
        Throws:
        WTException - , IOException if some error occurred while creating the cache.
        java.io.IOException
